body:
NOTE: this is just a random trace that shows the missing service names problem, I don't know if it's representative for any other issue.
NOTE2: afaict the service names don't show for any of our traces

makes sense actually, next release set Lens as default but still offer to
navigate back for one more release or so. Then the release after that
remove old UI.

On Thu, Oct 24, 2019 at 8:30 PM Daniele <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Lens has been around for more than a year now and a lot of development has
> gone into it. Before removing the old UI we should make it possible to have
> lens as default ui (most people at my company have never clicked the try
> lens button afaik).
>
> While we do this we should also add the button to go back to the default
> ui if people have any issue with lens though
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/2884?email_source=notifications&email_token=AABPKAFYJHUGOPN3B7UFHSDQQHSVZA5CNFSM4JEYCRI2YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFUVEXG43VMWVGG33NNVSW45C7NFSM4HUGFKJA>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AABPKAH6XFR6XMFCY4E5L5LQQHSVZANCNFSM4JEYCRIQ>
> .
>

Just to clarify, I didn't seen any issue or chat in gitter about actually deleting the old UI soon. I just think this is a good next step.
Also afaik most people in my company have never clicked on the try lens button, so changing the default is an easy way to have them try it out.
@adriancole Sorry, I added description!
thanks @drolando!
Thanks.. looks good. Can you describe what this trace is doing in abstract? I'll merge anyway, but if you want to update the README later, would be nice!
ps zipkin-slim has lens as default, but I think you use cassandra which is not in slim.

IIRC the reason we didn't make an env variable was that we didn't want to create a variable then have to delete it later. As mentioned, the transition is at a year so far, so might be fair enough to add a variable. So, I would recommend a variable to set lens as default vs set classic or lens. This way, even if we delete it later due to lens being default, it isn't breaking.

I raised this as take it or leave it. I'm not wandering down the path to make the cookies reversable as I think it is only checked for existence now. If it doesn't fit, someone else can do it (likely they won't), so I'd suggest just taking it :P https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/2886

Thanks for the summary. The only thing I might suggest is that #2537 needs to fit somewhere.. would the filtering by service be a part of a separate screen? If not, wouldn't we want to share the context here?

In a disconnected view like this, it would seem useful to me to have a way to link off to the traces view from a selected service, retaining the used from/to time parameters. Maybe inside the sidebar that opens when selecting a node?

> Thanks for the summary. The only thing I might suggest is that #2537 needs to fit somewhere.. would the filtering by service be a part of a separate screen? If not, wouldn't we want to share the context here?

+1, these changes are great but doesn't solve the issues when there are a huge cluster of services in one graph

I'm concerned that annotation bubbles may not be as visible in the new lens UI as they were in the classic UI. I have liked the ability to view annotation bubbles while scrolling through the trace. It is also often useful to compare annotations between multiple spans in a trace. Recent work done in #2736 has re-vamped the annotations in details view (looks great BTW), but I want to request that the bubbles still be retained in the trace view as well.

As far as #1923 is concerned, tool tips on the annotation bubbles in trace view may not be needed because that level of information can always be found in the span details.
Wow...wonderful hack...
Thank you for your great work!!
@tacigar which merges first? this or the other?

Please merge this first!
I think @bulicekj 's great work should be on the commit history!
@anuraaga Thank you for your kind reviews!

> In a disconnected view like this, it would seem useful to me to have a way to link off to the traces view from a selected service, retaining the used from/to time parameters. Maybe inside the sidebar that opens when selecting a node?

@bulicekj Thank you for your feedback!
I tried to implement that as follows.

![dependencies-page-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19551419/67661575-ebf27900-f9a4-11e9-9db9-a18b66ec45a3.gif)
PTAL ðŸ™‡

@adriancole Thank you so much!
You are my teacher! :)

note: this will bump anyone actively not interested in moving to okhttp v4 with the reverse problem. I think recently @vietj had a concern of some kind about okhttp version, presumably due to zipkin-junit.

There's no plan to remove MWS from zipkin-junit as this hasn't caused any problems and it is unlikely armeria will cause less in a testing tool.

In other words even if we use armeria directly in zipkin-server, it doesn't affect the decision in zipkin-junit. For this reason, I don't think it should be joined in any way to the dependency tree in zipkin-server. please keep this a discussion of which version zipkin-junit should use.

Got it. Thanks for the feedback @adriancole! 

Based on that, it makes sense to revert the change on `zipkin-parent` and `zipkin-server` and just change the version directly on `zipkin-junit`. I've just pushed a couple commits with this.
PTAL ðŸ™‡

using yelp.json I cannot read the labels.. they look obfuscated (firefox)

![Screenshot 2019-10-29 at 11 43 18 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64215/67736105-535e0680-fa41-11e9-9c96-f5e7ea833dbb.png)

same in safari. so it seems zooming in doesn't change the size of the labels it only makes the text blurry. I wonder if the font is not scaling for some reason. Possibly the font size for the dependency graph should be a function of how many nodes exist?

![Oct-29-2019 11-52-24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64215/67736423-910f5f00-fa42-11e9-9b01-80d002c42710.gif)

Thank you for your report.
I don't know the reason, but I think the root cause is in third party libraries (Vizceral? Three.js?)
Anyway, I don't know the solution at all, so I want to solve it later.

If the browser's zoomup is between 80% and 120%, we can read the label correctly.
So I don't think this is basically a big problem...
WDYT?
if the label size was larger, I'd be ok. right now I can barely read them
I can also run the previous just I don't recall the label text being so small before.. maybe it was..
@adriancole Please tell me your browser's zoom percentage?
The animated gif started with no zoom level. I will try to post a higher resolution screenshot of zero zoom level.
reason I try zoom was the labels were small and I couldn't read :P

I see. thank you.
I investigated it, but I could not found way to adjust the font size.
My best guess is the font size is fixed....
https://github.com/Netflix/vizceral/blob/45c8c49c7210e883d357ffb28b03de46132da6f3/src/base/nodeNameView.js#L84
I see. anyway I can read as long as I don't attempt zoom as it makes them worse.
I haven't tracked the comments from @anuraaga, but if they are considered, I'm fine to merge.

Thank you for sharing trace data!
I'll investigate the causes.

There's a major breaking change in 0.95.0 for how annotated services are run https://github.com/line/armeria/releases/tag/armeria-0.95.0

We need to add `@Blocking` to all annotated services that don't return `HttpResponse` or `CompletionStage` - I think in this codebase, it's just the query API that returns `AggregatedHttpResponse`, also can't forget in the kafka code to add it to all the methods returning a JSON object.

@anuraaga thank you for your review!
PTAL ðŸ™‡
@tacigar fyi @shsamkit mentioned he can use lens once this is closed and until then is using classic
oh and error-prone is also holding us back https://github.com/google/error-prone/issues/1106
so far so good locally!
great team work!

Because there is no uni tests for the DiscoverPage component now, I have to write them.
So WIP.

+1
Whenever zipkin takes a while to return a result I'm always unsure whether it found nothing or it's simply still waiting for a response
It'd be great to add the same to the trace view page, especially when querying by a specific traceId. But feel free to postpone that if it requires a lot of extra changes
Sorry by scrub I meant blot, which is what I'm doing. Difference is using asterisks instead of the weird character. Should we match the okhttp blotting?

I was just looking at the exact thing in okhttp, since multiple people on it.

but yeah it is more a style thing than anything else. The redact as in how humans redact with sharpee is more obviously redacted. otoh it is probably more cute than it is important. I'll leave it with you!

https://github.com/square/okhttp/pull/4287#discussion_r219717377
Yeah unfortunately the logs go to a static logger so not really testable - will add later if possible.
thanks much!

Forgot to mention, just in case it's an interesting cultural point - first thing I thought when opening that okhttp link was my fonts or GitHub's fonts are messed up. I think for many Asian users that block character would look a lot like [tofu](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noto_fonts?wprov=sfla1)

the root span is incorrect as it has the shared flag set, but there's no corresponding client for it. I suspect that's an instrumentation bug an earlier version worked around. When you delete the shared flag, it looks fine.

I would have guessed span-cleaner would have cleaned this..

https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/2900
Thanks @adriangonz
Thank you!
@jeqo FYI I tried to update to kafka 2.3.1 but the junit thing fails on method missing.. I guess signatures can change at any time huh :D
Thanks for merging @adriancole!
@brightvip could you help us by adding more context to your issue? Is not clear to me what are we trying to solve here.

@vikash2u I would recommend to use [gitter](https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin) to ask questions. We keep github for bugs and improvements.

To answer your questions: https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-collector/rabbitmq and https://github.com/openzipkin/brave/tree/master/instrumentation/spring-rabbit

hmm we changed the server to use slf4j not log4j2. won't this bust slim which doesn't use log4j2? 

if you look at the pom, you'll notice we use log4j2 in the big dist and simple logging in slim. An annotation approach might not work properly for this reason.

cc @jorgheymans

an idea from offline which is that the log counter is barely, if relevant in our dashboard as we always log to debug or trace. We swallow exceptions into logs yes, but at a low level. The indicator that there is a problem is drop metrics going up. In other words a counter on severe messages isn't likely to add signal and maybe we shouldn't have added that by default either https://github.com/openzipkin-attic/docker-zipkin/issues/213

So, another fix is to just delete that part of the dashboard and re-upload to grafana.
another solution is to make a custom condition for the log annotation so that it doesn't trip up the slim build
closing this in favor of updating grafana dashboard.
@tacigar Do you have time to take a quick look at this?

Thank you for your report!
If timestamps are not set for some spans, it seems that UI cannot handle it well.
I'll fix this bug as soon as possible.

Thank you for your report!
If there are multiple root spans in one trace, UI will only draw one of them.
I'll fix it ASAP.
Thank you!

@jeqo 

Hi jeqo
I am using zipkin-server- 2.19.1-exec now.
Data is stored in elasticsearch_6.8
Service name cannot be displayed
I checked the log and found that he needs
Elasticsearch_6.8 Data zipkin*span-2019-10-29,zipkin*span-2019-10-30
The total number of my data is: 565003201
I see the URL to get the service name: /zipkin/api/v2/services but return 503
And takes a long time

But in zipkin-server-2.12.2-exec.jar is normal
But it takes a long time
Thanks for the information @brightvip - I wonder if it's similar to #2809. Does the query fail after 11 seconds?

@anuraaga 
Yes 
He will fail after a certain time and return to 503
Should be query timeout
Are you considering finding a more efficient way to query?
I will wait first  #2809
I guess the piece where the timeout is used is already in place and this is just making it an option a user can configure, isn't?

Thanks for understanding - if possible, I was wondering whether the time to failure is almost exactly 11s, as opposed to for example 5s. If it's 11s, then indeed the fix to that issue will help you :)

> I wish we could have an option to disable hostname verification.

I still do not see that there is a option to disable hostname verification. This could be a useful thing.

@anuraaga 
thank you very much

Browser display time consuming

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5554201/68270514-6ce1fc80-0098-11ea-8688-1490186b384d.png)
Yeah there is a `11s` timeout currently in place, and this just adds an option so users can configure it.
Please join the gitter channel for specific questions https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin
Ok thanks
Thanks for the report - going to add the instrumentation module back in with https://github.com/openzipkin/docker-jre-full/pull/16
I have repushed openzipkin/zipkin:2.19.1 with a new base image including the instrument module. Can you give it a try? Please let us know if you still have an issue.

Hey, thanks for your contribution, and i'm pretty sure that it will work because i just did the same as your commit on the base JRE image and build the master on my local and does not see the error anymore.
Hmm that's weird - but yeah I'm fine with closing this and leaving as is

docker-compose.yml
version: '2'

services:

  zipkin:
    image: openzipkin/zipkin
    container_name: zipkin
    environment:
      - STORAGE_TYPE=cassandra3
      - CASSANDRA_ENSURE_SCHEMA=false
      - CASSANDRA_CONTACT_POINTS=172.16.31.96
      - KAFKA_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS=172.16.31.96:9092
      - JAVA_OPTS=-Dlogging.level.zipkin=DEBUG -Dlogging.level.zipkin2=DEBUG
    ports:
      - 9411:9411
    depends_on:
      - storage
      - kafka-zookeeper


  kafka-zookeeper:
    image: openzipkin/zipkin-kafka
    container_name: kafka-zookeeper
    ports:
      - 2181:2181
      - 9092:9092
      - 19092:19092
    environment:
      - KAFKA_ADVERTISED_HOST_NAME=kafka
      - KAFKA_ZOOKEEPER_CONNECT=172.16.31.96:2181
    volumes:
      - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock

  kafka-manager:
    image: solsson/kafka-manager
    container_name: kafka-manager
    ports:
      - 9000:9000
    environment:
      - ZK_HOSTS=172.16.31.96:2181
    volumes:
      - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime

  storage:
    image: openzipkin/zipkin-cassandra
    container_name: cassandra
    ports:
      - 9042:9042
    volumes:
      - ./cassandra-data:/cassandra/data
      - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime

  dependencies:
    image: openzipkin/zipkin-dependencies
    container_name: dependencies
    entrypoint: crond -f
    environment:
      - STORAGE_TYPE=cassandra3
      - CASSANDRA_CONTACT_POINTS=172.16.31.96
    volumes:
      - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime
    depends_on:
      - storage

networks:
  default:
    driver: bridge
    ipam:
      driver: default
      config:
        - subnet: 10.250.250.0/24

FWIW, I would also lobby that the annotations view be displayed in the same tabular format that the original zipkin-ui showed.  As is, it's visually a more daunting task to compare Relative Time between annotations.

Ref:
![annotations](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25107222/68803091-644f7000-061c-11ea-8501-b9108c1926d9.png)

Hi, it looks like you are building a custom zipkin server. Unfortunately we cannot provide support for custom servers, we are a small group of volunteers and custom servers can have so many variables that it is too big of a burden on our community.

Did you know there are pre-built distributions of zipkin? Please check out our documentation for more information: https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/zipkin-server/README.md
+1 The "Upload JSON" button is less useful when there's no way to download the json.
Thanks for reporting! Will try to get this released soon
I have few instance registed zipkin , And other doesn`t register :(
Closing and locking, please don't do this kind of thing
@tacigar do you have some time to check it?

As the [issue template](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/question.md) say, questions should be asked on [gitter](https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin). Please head there and we will help you. Regarding the login, you can check this comment: https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/782#issuecomment-433306013
We have an official PHP library so we can close this issue :p.

This knob was released in 2.19.2
Hi @brightvip - `QUERY_TIMEOUT` environment variable was added in 2.19.2. Can you see if setting it to `700s` (larger than your `ES_TIMEOUT`) fixes your issue?

> What we actually currently do is specify compiler target 1.8 and then retrofit it down to 1.6.

Thank you for trying this out. I must have forgot that we do some retro conversions of things like lambdas.
